strapiPost.title: Northwest Arkansas Sees Decrease In Residential Building Permits
strapiPost.content:
Residential building permits across Northwest Arkansas's four largest cities saw a 10.3% decrease in 2022 compared to the previous year.

  • Ups and downs: There were 1,582 residential permits issued last year, valuing $661.03m, compared to 2021's 1,764 permits totaling $578.61m.
  • The hot spot: Standing apart from the pack, Centerton ended the year with 770 residential permits, a 32% increase over the 583 permits issued in 2021.  

Learn more about real estate and building trends HERE.
